description: Meeting offers a chance to reboot ties amid divide over Taiwan, technology and, lately, the Middle East.

title: Maine Mass Shooting Suspect's Body Found at Site Where He Had Worked
description: The body of Robert Card was discovered at a recycling facility after its owner asked authorities to return to search a parking lot.

title: Latest Updates on Evan Gershkovich
description: Soccer fans at the Arsenal and Sheffield United match hold a banner to wish a happy birthday to Gershkovich, the Wall Street Journal reporter who remains in a Russian jail. Follow the latest updates here.

title: Latest Updates on Detained WSJ Reporter Evan Gershkovich
description: The Wall Street Journal’s Evan Gershkovich was detained in Russia on March 29 while on a reporting trip and accused of espionage, making him the first American journalist detained in Russia on such charges since the Cold War.

title: A Couple Paid Down Most of Their Debt. Now They Need a New Financial Plan
description: They want to build an emergency fund and start planning for children. A financial adviser offers her suggestions for how they can best get there.

title: Palestinian Death Statistics Remain a Subject of Controversy
description: Three weeks into Israel’s massive bombing campaign in the Gaza Strip, the exact scope of Palestinian casualties has become yet another controversy after President Biden questioned statistics published by the Hamas-run Gaza health authorities.

title: Blue Owl to Expand Life-Sciences Business with Cowen Investments Acquisition
description: Blue Owl Capital will bring on the life-sciences investment team from Cowen Investment Management, in a deal intended to expand the firm’s presence in a hot sector for alternative-investment managers.

title: Israel Says It Has Killed a Planner of Oct. 7 Attack
description: Israel’s military said its ground forces continued to fight inside Gaza after an intense wave of airstrikes and ground raids overnight targeted Hamas’s extensive network of underground tunnels and killed leaders of the militant group involved in the planning of the attack on Israel.

title: Iranian Girl Dies Weeks After Alleged Clash with Security Forces
description: The teenager, whose collapse in a Tehran metro station raised public suspicion that she had been attacked by morality patrol officers for not covering her hair, has died.

title: The Tech CEO Who Won't Use Email
description: Sarah Dorsett, chief executive of high-tech baby-monitor company Nanit, is reachable by text, on Slack and Messenger. As she explains in “On My Phone,” if she’s using her mail app, it’s to delete messages, not read them.
